title: Practical Online Workshop for Language Education Design to Enhance Educational Technology Expertise

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational technology theories or learning experience in language education (grammar, reading comprehension, expression strategies), along with basic text analysis skills in digital environments
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-enabled learning environments, utilizing online collaboration tools (digital whiteboards, real-time document editing) to develop language education materials. Enables educational content creation using vocabulary databases and multimedia resources.

learning_goals: Master core competencies of educational technology specialists (e.g., instructional design, project management, language learning theory application) at 80% or higher and acquire language teaching techniques, including text analysis and vocabulary selection strategies.

Analyze two or more collaboration scenarios with diverse stakeholders and develop practical language education applications, including communication strategies using reading and expression techniques.

Integrate 21st-century competencies (critical thinking, digital literacy) into language curriculum design through project deliverables (e.g., text analysis, vocabulary selection, activity design) and produce educational materials reflecting grammatical structures and cultural contexts.

resources: ETCS (European Transfer and Accumulation System) survey tool template
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
